page.title: 10THE GROVE HUNT.
page.content: The Grove Hunt is an independent pack of hounds with a history going back into the 19th century.It amalgamated with the Rufford Hunt in 1957.The present kennels are at Barnby Moor.The Grove 'country' extends well beyond the Grove area,from the River Trent in the East to the A614 in the West.It reaches to Newark in the South and Epworth in the North. This 'country' used to provide the original extended packs with six days a week hunting.The construction of the M1,A1 and M18 motorways have now made it possible to hunt only two days a week. The Hunt now meets on Tuesdays and Saturdays during the main part of the season.The season is from the last Tuesday in October until the middle of March. Cub Hunting takes place between the beginning of September until the end of October.
